title: Oscars 2018: Winners and reaction - BBC News
summary: the shape of water wins the most oscars with four .
its prizes include best film and director .
frances mcdormand wins best actress , and gary oldman best actor .
sam rockwell wins best supporting actor .
allison janney wins best supporting actress .

documents.title: goodnight ( or good morning )
text: thanks for joining us for our live coverage of the oscars ( and we 're sorry we could n't blag us all free entry to the after party ) .

we know what you need most in your life now - a helpful cluster of links to all the rest of our overnight coverage so that you can have a nice enjoyable onward journey to other areas of the bbc news website :

we 'll leave you with our favourite from the night - phantom thread costume designer mark bridges scooting off with dame helen mirren on the jet ski jimmy kimmel awarded him for successfully delivering the shortest acceptance speech of the ceremony .
( there 's a sentence we 've never written before . )
we 'll see you next year .

documents.title: facts & figures
text: because who does n't love a good stat .
here 's some analysis of this year 's winners and their place in academy history :
and here 's how all the best winners have performed at the us box office so far ( we suspect the shape of water in particular might just increase its takings this week . )

documents.title: gary oldman reflects on the moment he won
text: gary oldman is the latest star to turn up at the vanity fair after party - fresh from getting his best actor statue engraved .
there 's a weird chemical thing that happens in your brain when your name is called .
i ca n't really define it but it 's unlike anything else .
you 've got meryl streep 10 feet away staring up at you next to denzel washington .

documents.title: the after parties are in full swing
text: `` just take me anywhere , take me anywhere .
anywhere away with you as long as it 's in a limo straight to the vanity fair oscars after party please , '' as rita ora almost sang .

miley cyrus has also turned up at the biggest bash in town - we 're not sure why but who cares because let 's be honest there 's literally no situation in life that can not be improved by the arrival of miley cyrus .

documents.title: collaring kaluuya
text: our arts correspondent rebecca jones is at the vanity fair party , where she just managed to grab get out star daniel kaluuya ( along with cinematographer roger deakins ) for long enough to get his reaction to tonight 's winners .
`` i 'm happy , man .
jordan [ peele ] won an oscar , roger won an oscar .
i 'm just happy for good people who do the work and are recognised .
for me , it fills me with joy seeing that . ''
asked if he knew get out would be so successful when he first read it , he said :
i felt it .
i do n't really make decisions based on whether something is going to be successful , i base it on whether i would want to watch it .

documents.title: faye dunaway on returning to the oscars
text: faye dunaway has just been on bbc breakfast ahead of the vanity fair party , discussing her return to the ceremony this year to announce the best winner alongside warren beatty .
she said : `` even though the card was wrong , i felt there was a slight stigma , '' - regarding her and beatty 's part in the mishap .
`` and i 'm so glad the academy found a way [ to bring us back ] .
`` in psychiatry , there 's the theory of repetition , you repeat something until it comes out right .
we have a bond warren and me , and it was lovely to get the standing ovation , and it was lovely being with him and it was nice doing it again .

speaking about the atmosphere in la , she added : `` they 're in the streets , they 're dancing , they 're shouting out for the cars , it 's like a carnival a little bit , but the seriousness is there . ''

documents.title: it 's time to party
text: the stars are arriving thick and fast at the post-oscars vanity fair party in hollywood .

documents.title: 'it 's spelled g-u-i-l-l-e-r-m-o '
text: you 've won an oscar .
you 've thanked your parents .
you 've spoken to the journalists backstage .
basically , now you just want to go out on the lash at the various la after parties .
but before you do - there 's one last little job that needs completing .

because of the huge level of secrecy that surrounds the oscars voting in the run up to the ceremony the organisers leave the trophies blank , so that there 's no way of anyone finding out the winners beforehand .
so the winners get their statuettes engraved with their name or film straight after the ceremony .
guillermo del toro , gary oldman , frances mcdormand and jordan peele have already got theirs sorted :

documents.title: james ivory makes history
text: ivory , at the age of 89 , became the oldest person to ever win an academy award in a competitive category .
`` that 's the only thing they 've got remember about me , '' the screenwriter laughed as he spoke to the bbc .
he said he was `` excited and thrilled '' to have won best adapted screenplay for call me by your name - but he was n't necessarily surprised .
`` the press have said again and again that i was the front runner , so there was n't that element of surprise , but still , i might not have won , '' he laughed .
asked about his shirt , which had a drawing of the film 's star timothee chalamet 's face on it , he explained :
it was painted by an english artist named andrew mania who lives in bristol , and he had the idea of doing a shirt with timothee 's face on it , and i said fine , i 'll wear it !

documents.title: the help cast reunite
text: and fortunately viola davis was there to make sure this glorious moment was documented ( in the form of a selfie ) .
# thehelp ladies doing it ! ! !
# oscars

that is allison janney sir ! !

strong , amazing women !
we love u ! !
triple threats ! ! !

love it ! ! ! !

these ladies do n't need no help .

documents.title: which films missed out ?
text: there was a fairly even mix across the winners this year - with prizes for the shape of water , three billboards , get out , i tonya and darkest hour .
so which films were snubbed ?
lady bird was one of the night 's big losers - it did n't up any of the prizes it was nominated for , despite being praised by critics and audiences alike .
director greta gerwig was beaten by guillermo del toro , saoirse ronan lost out to frances mcdormand for best actress , while the film itself lost out in both the best and best original screenplay .
there was also nothing for the post ( starring meryl streep , or mudbound , despite multiple nominations .
roman j israel , esq , the florida project , all the money in the world each had one nomination for this year 's oscars - but all went home empty handed .

documents.title: gary oldman 's words of wisdom for timothee chalamet
text: the oscars do love it when an actor slaps on some make-up and transforms into a british prime minister .
( see also : meryl streep winning for the iron lady in 2011 . )
gary oldman said there was a `` special significance '' to winning the best actor oscar for playing sir winston churchill in darkest hour .
i ca n't say what it would be like to win an oscar in any other year .
but winning an oscar for playing arguably one of the greatest britons who ever lived ?
to win it for playing winston makes it doubly special .
and he revealed he 'd had some words of wisdom for fellow best actor nominee timothee chalamet .
i 'm thrilled for chalamet .
he 's a lovely kid .
he really is , he 's a charmer .
he 's hugely talented .
i said to him tonight - in the words of arnie - 'you 'll be back ' .
it 's probably the end for me - he 's got years .
and with that - he 's off , doing a comedy walk off the stage after initially walking the wrong way .

documents.title: sign language at the oscars
text: rachel shenton 's speech used sign language - while she is not the first to do so , she 's in a select group .
others include jane fonda , who signed part of her speech for winning best actress for coming home at the 1979 oscars .
louise fletcher did the same at the 1976 oscars when she was named best actress for one flew over the cuckoo 's nest .
and at the 1987 oscars , marlee matlin - who lost her hearing as a child - also signed her speech for children of a lesser god .
she was best actress too .
we had a bit of signing in the press room as well - with congratulations being offered by one journalist in sign language .

documents.title: 'there was such a shortage of role models '
text: jordan peele said backstage there was a `` renaissance '' going on right now in the film world .
i almost never became a director because there was such a shortage of role models .
i feel so proud to be a part of a time , the beginning of a movement where i feel like the best films in every genre are being brought to me by my fellow black directors .
it 's very special .
i think that goes for all areas of inclusion .
it 's quite clear that this is a very special time .
he said he especially enjoyed getting to chat to gary oldman backstage - saying he had been his favourite actor since bram stoker 's dracula and true romance .
author: Lauren Turner
Entertainment Reporter

documents.title: you shall go to the ball
text: the main ceremony may be over , but now the parties begin
here are some of the attendees at the swanky governor 's ball where 1,500 guests are dining on more than 50 dishes including 30 pounds ( 13.6 kg ) of edible gold dust .
let 's hope no-one chews an oscar by mistake .

documents.title: frances mcdormand praises billboard movements
text: her speech was one of the most electrifying moments of the night .
and frances mcdormand was applauded for it in the press room - being the only winner to get a standing ovation as she walked in to be interviewed .
`` do n't give me any more attention , '' she quips .
`` it will go to my head . ''

( as she was speaking to reporters , she paused to laugh at the fact journalists wanting to ask questions are asked to hold up pieces of paper with numbers on , saying : `` it 's like we 're bidding on art . '' )
one of the impacts the film has had is the copycat billboards of protest that have sprung up around the world .
mcdormand is definitely here for it , crying : `` off the screen and onto the street !
it 's really exciting . ''
she mentions that the grenfell tower fire campaigners justice 4 grenfell were among the first to use billboards to draw attention to their cause .
the idea that activists are taking that statement and putting it out there ?
billboards still work - they still work , and it 's really exciting .
author: Lauren Turner
Entertainment Reporter

documents.title: the actors ' class photo
text: the winners of all four acting categories gathered together backstage for the traditional group photo .
but we love this extra unposed which was taken just before the official one .

there 's sam rockwell and frances mcdormand glancing at each other on the left , with the mischievous look of two people who are planning a massive diamond heist as soon as they can get out of the dolby theatre .

meanwhile , allison janney looks like she 's instantly regretting asking gary oldman to explain just what is the correct way to make the perfect cup of english breakfast tea he referred to in his acceptance speech .

documents.title: 'am i being auctioned off ? '
text: some winners seemed a bit bemused by the press room system that sees journalists holding up numbers , in order to be called on to ask questions ( fyi mine was 143 ) .

but for jordan peele , winner of best original screenplay for get out , it had slightly more sinister connotations - that 's thanks to a scene in the film where there 's some altogether more sinister bidding going on .
am i being auctioned off right now ?
it 's creepy .
and then we had gary oldman suddenly transform into a bingo caller , saying : `` am i playing bingo right now ?
one and four , 14 .
one and one , legs eleven ( he accompanied this last bit with a wolf whistle ) .
author: Lauren Turner
Entertainment Reporter

documents.title: guillermo del toro is taking his oscars to meet his folks
text: a very sweet moment in the press room from guillermo del toro , holding aloft his two oscars for the shape of water - best director and best
my next step is going to see my mom and dad next week .
i 'm going home - with these two babies .

documents.title: which way 's the ocean ?
text: here 's that unforgettable moment right at the end of the show ( almost three hours and 50 mins after it started ) when the winner for best costume design mark bridges glided onto the stage clutching his oscar and riding a jetski accompanied by dame helen mirren .
bridges won the vehicle for giving the shortest oscar speech of the night .
the look on his face makes us wonder which prize he likes best .

documents.title: allison janney : 'i did n't dare to dream '
text: everyone seems to be delighted by allison janney up her first oscar for playing tonya harding 's domineering mother lavona golden in i , tonya .
she 's talked about channeling her inner critic to inspire the role , saying she chose to speak to margot robbie ( who plays tonya ) the way she sometimes speaks to herself .
so , in the interview room backstage , i asked her what her inner voice is saying now .
her reply was met by a round of applause :
bravo .
good going , girl .
i 'm proud of you .
she said of her win : `` i did n't dare to dream of things like this because i did n't want to be disappointed .
at a certain point , i 'd given up on something like this happening to me . ''
proof , if it was needed , to never , ever give up - and to use your own inner voice to give yourself a pat on the back .
( bonus points go to allison too for being wonderfully candid about how uncomfortable heels can be )
can i take my shoes off ?
my feet are bleeding .
author: Lauren Turner
Entertainment Reporter

documents.title: right , so what exactly is an inclusion rider ?
text: `` i have two words to leave with you tonight , '' said frances mcdormand .
the word waited , desperate to hear what was coming next .
`` inclusion rider . ''
pardon ?
did she say writer maybe ?
no , definitely rider .
but what does that mean ?
theories were quickly forthcoming on social media , but some figures in the acting community were on hand to help out :
and , speaking backstage , mcdormand clarified her meaning :
what 's an 'inclusion rider ' ?
frances mcdormand explains backstage after her # oscars speech
walk the walk , hollywood !
yes , great idea , but after what we 've seen women going through just to get or keep their jobs , how many will have enough juice to `` demand '' this rider ?
the white men in power have no impetus to change unless they want it & have n't seen it in job stats so far .
well , if all the women in hollywood refused to work without it , what do you think would happen .
we all have juice .
i have never ever in my entire career had my requests refused .
i have had to fight for them , play hardball , and be willing to walk away , but it always works out in the end .
negotiating in hollywood is just a big game of chicken .
think you 're stronger than most & a key-not sure that happens for everyone .
not many willing to walk away .
we have talked before about freelance climate of being afraid of where/when your next job will be & that they 'll just go to the next person on the list .
yup .
people have become incredibly weak .
i have worked in freelance climate for most of my career .
i have just never believed what the people hiring me were telling me during negotiations .
of course they continue to sell the idea that someone is waiting for your bob .
it works !
it works very easily .
yet we all work on shows that are constantly desperate for qualified crew .
threaten to quit , just once and see what happens .
they will fold , every single time
yes , does take courage !

you go through same moving up the ladder from being an intern & then eventually as a pa. you will get used ( was doing ad & pc/pm work as a pa on pa pay ) until you put your foot down , stop selling yourself short & say no , i 'm worth it !
its absurd .
to demand that half the crew must be male or female .
what about just hire the best and most qualified person for the job .
it 's gon na be so fun when you 're super qualified for something but you 're passed over repeatedly because you 're just some white dude and then you 'll be like , `` ohhhhhh i get it now . ''
the slippery slope argument .
a favorite of white males .
not only b/c it has never shown to be true , but also b/c those that use it to rationalize being rejected from a particular job severely overvalue how qualified they actually are .
the rejection is probably b/c of their ego .
most qualified people should get the job .
regardless of age , race , religion , sex or sexual preference .
i do n't see much of a counter argument to that statement that would hold much weight .
the argument below on how ppl other than white males have been denied opportunity to gain similar experience pretty much shuts your argument down .
you ca n't exclude others & then use the advantage you preferentially confer to one group of ppl as the criteria for selection .
sorry .
so the cure for discrimination of one group in the past is discrimination of another group in the future ?
nope , that 's just what scared white people like to say .
the reality is , sometimes you have to legislate to normalize .
once enough women and minorities are in positions of authority , the problem does n't become a problem anymore , then we can all live in your blissful meritocracy .
let me ask you this .
if a black or female conservative were running for a position of power against a white liberal male , what would your choice be ?
( with neither being far right or far left . )
for all of us who work in film and television .
include those of us behind the camera in the discussion .
reading some discussion on this is depressing .
it is not that women ca n't do these jobs as well as men .
it is that they are not given the opportunity in the first place .
i need to stop reading comments for a while
i know plenty of individuals , both men and women , who are fully qualified for a job and are never even given a second thought .
it 's not oppressive , it 's called life .
caleb , leave this one to the adults , hun .
an inclusion rider '' is a clause in an actor 's contract that requires the cast and crew be diverse in order to retain the actor .
that 's kind of a brave thing to say on such a big stage .
to clarify further : it 's brave because you 're saying up front , if you wo n't commit to inclusion , i wo n't take your money . ''
and it matters because it puts pressure on a studio 's bottom line .
props to frances mcdormand .
for real .
if demanding a `` diverse cast '' is a requirement , coming to america , amadeus , lord of the rings , black panther , schindler 's list etc .
would not have been made .
or they would have been made by diverse crews with diverse casts .
what 's hard to understand ?
exactly how do you make a film with a diverse cast when , by the terms of the story , the characters are of the same ethnicity ?
sigh 1 .
the crew are not on camera .
most , if not all characters , are not intrinsically ethno- or gender-specific .
e.g. , characters in lotr do n't have to all be white , bsg made starbucks female 3 .
there are infinite great diverse stories .
yeah , and lotr was filmed in new zealand where there are a whopping 2 ethnic groups , schindler 's list in poland .
but hey , great idea they should have cast toshiro mifune as antonio salieri or wesley snipes as oskar schindler .
hamilton seems to have done ok with it .
a musical play is hardly a historical drama .
imagine the backlash if the reverse was true : a bio pic of martin luther king or rosa parks where the lead is not played by a black actor .
you could do it , but you 'd have to change the narrative so much , it 's a different story .
of course there are a handful of roles where a specific ethnicity , nationality , gender of a character are essential to the meaning .
very few though , and even then , the whole cast rarely needs to be homogeneous .
also , literally 100s of ghost in the shells , so you know , precedent .
that inclusion rider needs to also include people with disabilities !
consider oscar winner # thesilentchild.the child actress is actually deaf .
# inclusionrider # cripthevote # oscarsdiss # oscars90live
there are a host of categories folks may want to demand .
gender , age , race , sexual orientation , and disability are the beginning .
sexual orientation ?
what are they going to do ?
start asking the gaffers and carpenters if they are gay ?
this would be a good start .
why ?
since when does personal , private conduct have any bearing on whether or not one should get a job which is completely irrelevant to their ability to complete the required tasks ?
thanks doc !
wassup , kofi !
why is it a brave thing ?
is it because they 're rare or taboo ?
some are less willing to hire you if you insist on them hiring a diverse cast .
sooo she would n't have worked on black panther ?
yes she could have in the crew or cast or producing inclusion means being aware that the world is not just straight white men so the work environment should not be just only straight white men .
that sounds an awful lot like by `` inclusion and diversity '' you mean `` let 's replace everyone with black people '' .
only if you have absolutely no idea what you 're talking about .
not that hard to do a simple google search and actually learn a tiny little bit about a subject before remarking on it or just be complacent in your ignorance .
up to you .
so you are ok with the great wall or 47 ronin since the inclusion of a white guy in the cast technically made them more diverse ?
there you go , showing that you do n't actually know what it is .

documents.title: the final tally
text: a quick reminder of the night 's biggest winners

documents.title: twitter is not loving emma stone
text: look , we 're sure she meant well .
but people on twitter really were n't keen on emma stone 's introduction of the best director category .
`` these four men and greta gerwig created their own masterpieces this year , '' she said , looking rather pleased with herself for highlighting the male-dominated category .

but unlike natalie portman 's handling of the issue at the globes in january , or sandra bullock 's comments earlier tonight , viewers thought her point was a little inelegant and took away from the progressive nominations for guillermo del toro and jordan peele .
emma stone doing a similar comment to natalie portman 's on most of the directors being men is n't funny or progressive , it 's tacky and bitter .
# oscars
anyway , white feminism is emma stone saying `` four men and greta gerwig '' as if jordan peele and guillermo del toro 's nominations as men of color are n't as important .
there have only been five women nominated for best director in 90 years .
a black man being nominated is great for different reasons , but does n't alter the skewed gender ratio .
how many black men have been nominated ?
five .
the academy needs to do better for women and for ethic minorities and for lgbt+ people .
you can care about more than one issue at once .
yep 5 .
i believe it 's important to care about many issues at once but you 're talking about gender skewed issues like black men have the same privileges as white men which is not helpful .
it is n't to white feminism .
i know she was trying to have a natalie portman moment with the these four men and greta gerwig '' joke , but it was trash .
# oscars

anyways emma stone saying four men and greta gerwig '' was stupid because it completely disregards how two people of color were nominated for best director , just because theyre not women doesnt mean that their noms were n't meaningful # oscars

documents.title: head to head
text: a lovely moment captured here as meryl streep congratulates frances mcdormand on winning the best actress oscar .

documents.title: people were loving tonight 's set design
text: and we do n't blame them .
provided you 're a fan of crystals .
the extravagant set for the # oscars was built with 45 million swarovski crystals , took 3,250 hours to complete , and weighed 15,000 pounds .
needless to say , folks on twitter did n't fail to notice it .
what a complete waste of money .
what are they going to do with the 4.5 million crystals ?
jane fonda said the set looked like , barberella . ''
everyone has to agree w her once in a lifetime .
absolutely stunning !
great use of money pathetic .
piece of art

documents.title: more to come from backstage
text: the ceremony may be over - but backstage in the interview room , there are still quite a lot of winners ( seven , we 're told by the press team ) due to speak .
they include gary oldman , allison janney , frances mcdormand and jordan peele .
we 'll bring you more from them when we get it .
author: Lauren Turner
Entertainment Reporter

documents.title: the shape of water is dividing opinion
text: well .
the best winner is certainly splitting opinion .
absolutely delighted with that ; the shape of water winning best picture , screenplay oscar for get out , mcdormand 's wonderful speech , del toro is the king # oscars
really pleased with the diversity in wins this year .
shape of water had 13 noms and only came out with 4 oscars .
as much as i loved the movie and feel as though it deserves everything , the diversity in wins shows how amazing the year 2017 was for film .
i 'm very happy for del toro and the team , but the shape of water is my least favorite best picture winner in many years .
my least favorite of any of the nominees this year .
# oscars
same here
how many years are we talking here ? , as you look about 15 .

documents.title: roger deakins on ( finally ) winning an oscar
text: it took 14 nominations - but roger deakins finally has an oscar in his hand ( as well as the envelope which revealed he was the winner ) .
he 's managing to be seemingly nonchalant about it though , shrugging when asked what it means for the wait to be over .
what 's important to him is who else is nominated tonight though .
we were coming to the academy this evening and i was reminded one of my early films was sid and nancy with gary oldman .
it 's so wonderful to be here tonight and gary to be in the same space .
despite seeming calm , he says he definitely was n't on the oscars stage .
he says : `` a big part of me was saying 'please , please no ' .
i find it very hard . ''
he thanked all those who 've worked with him during his illustrious career .
i 've worked with a lot of the same people in my crew for years and i feel it 's recognition for their work , i really do .

documents.title: and the jetski goes to
text: i bet phantom thread costume designer mark bridges did n't expect he would be riding onto the dolby theatre stage on a jetski , clutching an oscar , accompanied by dame helen mirren , when he turned up this evening .
he looks pretty delighted about it though .
he won it for making the shortest speech of the night - turns out jimmy kimmel put his money where his mouth is .
his winning time was 36 seconds , by the way .
someone really won the jetski , awesome !
# oscars
he was the 2nd guy who won an oscar tonight .
totally forgot what for though
costume design , i think

documents.title: winner : best
text: and the winner is
the shape of water
blimey .
this is a little surprising .
three billboards was thought to be the favourite to take home the night 's big prize .
but in the end , the fairytale story about a mute cleaner who falls in love with an amphibious creature takes the trophy .
guillermo del toro makes his way to the stage accept the prize , jokingly checking warren beatty 's envelope .
`` a few weeks ago , steven spielberg said , 'if you find yourself on the podium , remember that you are part of a world of filmmakers , and be proud of it ' .
`` i want to dedicate this to every young filmmaker that is showing us how things are done , really they are .
in every country in the world .
`` when i was a kid enamoured with movies , growing up in mexico , i thought this could never happen , it happens .
`` everyone that is using the genre of fantasy to tell the story about things that are happening in the world today , you can do it .
this is a door , kick it open and come in . ''
the other nominees were :

documents.title: they 're back !
text: warren beatty and faye dunaway return to the stage to present best what could possibly go wrong this year ?
`` as they say , presenting is lovelier the second time around , '' jokes faye .
as they were being introduced by jimmy kimmel , the chat show host joked that what happened last year was just `` waterhouse under the bridge . ''
( a reference to pricewaterhousecoopers who were responsible for the envelope mishap . )

documents.title: a change in tradition for presenters in the acting categories
text: usually , you get the best actor from the previous year presenting the award to the best actress - and vice versa .
but things were changed up a bit when casey affleck decided to pull out of presenting ( he 'd won the oscar for manchester by the sea at the 2017 awards ) .
instead , we 've had the best actress award presented by jodie foster and jennifer lawrence , and the best actor presented by helen mirren and jane fonda .
emma stone , who would have traditionally given out that oscar , was the presenter for best director instead .
author: Lauren Turner
Entertainment Reporter

documents.title: winner - best actress
text: frances mcdormand for three billboards outside ebbing , missouri
no surprises here - mcdormand has won every best actress prize going this awards season , including the same accolade at the baftas and the golden globes .
`` i 'm hyperventilating a little bit .
if i fall over me up cause i 've got some things to say , '' she says .
`` i want to thank martin mcdonagh look what you did .
we are a bunch of hooligans and anarchists but we do clean up nice .
she continues : `` if i may be so honoured to have all the female nominees stand with me in this room tonight .
the film makers the producers the directors , the writers , the cinematographers , the songwirters , the designers , '' she says - as many women in the audience get to their feet .
`` look around , because we all have stories to tell , '' mcdormand says .
`` i have two words to leave with you tonight : inclusion rider . ''
the whole world googles the term inclusion rider
the other nominees were :

documents.title: winner : best actor
text: gary oldman - darkest hour
my deepest thanks to the academy for this glorious prize , '' oldman says .
the movies - such is their power - captivated a young man from south london and gave him a dream .
i 'd like to salute winston churchill who has been marvellous company on what has been an incredible journey . ''
oldman also thanks his mother who is 99 years young next birthday '' and who is watching from the comfort of her sofa '' .
put the kettle on - i 'm bringing oscar home . ''
the award was presented by jane fonda and helen mirren .

documents.title: winner : best director
text: the shape of water - guillermo del toro

accepting the prize , he says : `` i am an immigrant , like many of you and i think the greatest thing our industry does is to erase the lines in the sand , we should continue doing that when the world tells us to make them deeper .
he also thanks fox searchlight , `` because in 2014 they came to listen to a mad pitch , and they believed that a fairytale about an amphibian man and a mute woman was a sure bet . ''
this is the fourth win for a mexican director in five years .
the other nominees in this category were :

documents.title: what 's still to come ?
text: it does n't feel like there have been any huge surprises yet .
most of those expected to up oscars have done so - several of whom , like allison janney and sam rockwell , had already collected an armful of awards for their films .
but we could have a few surprises still to come , as we 're not too far away from finding out who 's won best
it 's been such a tightly-fought race and still feels , at this stage , like it could go to a number of films .
the shape of water went into the academy awards as the film holding the most nominations - but some feel it has lost its momentum in the best race .
then there 's three billboards - but some feel a few of its characters were problematic .
now that jordan peele has up the original screenplay for get out , could he go all the way and win best it would certainly be a popular win .
on the red carpets at all the pre-oscars awards and events this week , it was the film the other stars seemed to mention the most .
we do n't have long to go to find out

documents.title: in memoriam
text: the in memoriam section pays tribute to some of the figures from the world of film we 've lost in the past year .
eddie vedder performed tom petty 's room at the top .
sir roger moore , sridevi , jonathan demme , john heard , don rickles and shashi kapoor are among the names remembered .

documents.title: the silent child filmmakers on 'amazing ' win
text: rachel shenton and chris overton are backstage with us .
this is amazing .
it means the world to us .
not only as film-makers and creatives , but the subject is incredibly close to my heart .
i 'm so proud of us , putting disability in front of a huge audience .
her fiance chris overton says when their name was called , he looked up to where maisie sly was sitting and could see her shouting with happiness .
rachel adds with a smile : `` i 'm surprised she stayed awake ! ''
chris says it 's `` incredible '' to get this kind of platform and that the win is `` huge for deafness and for deaf people '' .
author: Lauren Turner
Entertainment Reporter

documents.title: sandra bullock ages backwards
text: as sandra bullock takes to the stage to present best cinematography , she asks producers to dim the lights to make her look younger .
`` oooh , that 's good , a little lower , '' she says , joking that she wants to look like she 's still in her forties .
she then goes on to introduce the `` four men and one trail-blazing woman '' who are nominated in this category .

documents.title: young star of silent child was confident of win
text: rachel shenton seemed unsure about the film 's prospects of winning when we spoke to her on the red carpet earlier .
she said she was n't thinking about the possibility - but did say she would celebrate with `` mugs of champagne '' if they did .
one person who might not be surprised though is maisie herself - she 'd told the bbc she thought they 'd win the award .
but asked who she was looking forward to meeting , she said donald duck - when she goes to disneyland tomorrow .

he thanks everyone who went to see it and for shouting out at the screen '' .
this is a significant win .
it 's extremely rare for the best winner not to win either best original or best adapted screenplay .
given that call me by your name is unlikely to win best - does this win mean that get out is in with a shot of taking the night 's big prize ?

my rule number one for a screenwriter who adapts a novel is to thank the author of the novel , '' says james ivory as he thanks andre aciman , who wrote the book the film is based on .
ivory describes call me by your name as `` a story familiar to most of us , whether straight , gay or somewhere in between .
we 've all gone through our first love , and come out the other side mostly intact . ''
he also thanks `` the film 's wonderful emotion-filled actors '' as the camera cuts to timothee chalamet - who is also up for best actor later tonight for his performance in the same film .

he said he felt a sense of validation by winning the oscar - and that he was pleased he did n't have to sit in an ice bath after this victory .

documents.title: winner : best live action short
text: the silent child - chris overton and rachel shenton
you might know british actress rachel shenton as mitzee in hollyoaks but she 's now also an oscar winner for her short film the silent child .
`` i made a promise to our six-year-old lead actress that i 'd sign this speech , but my hands are shaking a little bit so i apologise , '' she said as she took to the stage .
`` our movie is about a deaf child being born into a world of silence .
it 's not exaggerated or sensationalised for the movie , this is happening .
children all over the world face communication barriers . ''

documents.title: best foreign film director 'ca n't believe ' oscar win
text: sebastian lelio , director of a fantastic woman , seems shocked by his win as he chats backstage .
`` i ca n't believe this happened , '' he says .
`` i knew the film was a front-runner and everything .
but you 're never really sure until the oscar is in your hand .
`` i 'm happy for the team , and for what it represents . ''
he says the film represents `` a necessary and urgent conversation '' .
`` it has been a struggle to recognise the existence of transgender people , '' he adds .
author: Lauren Turner
Entertainment Reporter in Hollywood

documents.title: winner - best animated short
text: dear basketball - glen keane and kobe bryant
yes , that 's kobe bryant the basketball legend .
the other nominees were :

documents.title: winner : best supporting actress
text: allison janney for i , tonya
the actress was heavily tipped to win this , which is one of the biggest prizes of the night .
janney , who is well known for her role as cj in the west wing , played tonya harding 's pushy mother in the story of the former figure skater 's life .
`` thank you to the academy , my fellow nominees , you represent everything that is good and human about this industry , '' she says .
she also thanks the i , tonya family , including `` the magnificent margot robbie '' , who produced and played the title role of the film .
the other nominees were :

documents.title: winner : best foreign language film
text: a fantastic woman ( chile )
the film , directed by sebastian lelio , tells the story of a young transgender woman ( daniela vega ) who comes up against discrimination after the death of her older boyfriend .
the other nominees were :

documents.title: jet ski update
text: `` i feel like you guys are n't taking the jet ski thing as seriously as i 'd hoped , '' jokes jimmy kimmel as the ceremony resumes after another break .
he 's referring to a joke at the beginning of the show where he offered a jet ski to the winner with the shortest acceptance speech tonight ( modelled by dame helen mirren ) .
he says mark bridges is winning so far for his snappy acceptance speech for costume design ( for phantom thread ) .

documents.title: 'daniel day-lewis made me up my game '
text: mark bridges has just been chatting to the press room about his oscar for the sumptuous costumes in phantom thread - set in the world of fashion itself .
he 's worked with paul thomas anderson , the director of the film for 22 years , and says this was `` another one in the bag of tricks paul has '' .
he says of working on the film :
there 's a little bit of pressure .
will i be able to do justice to the era ?
of course , working with daniel [ day-lewis ] , you up your game .
paul and daniel made me want to be a better designer .
he says he went shopping with day-lewis in london 's jermyn street as part of the research for the film .
a whole wardrobe of outfits was then bought for his character .
paul wanted him to choose daily what he wanted to wear .
that was a new one for me .
he says too that it was great having `` the luxury of working in london where there are makers of fabrics and access to europe that we do n't have here '' .
author: Lauren Turner
Entertainment Reporter

documents.title: winner : best production design
text: the shape of water - production design by paul denham austerberry ; set decoration by shane vieau and jeff melvin
keep dreaming up your monsters , '' austerberry said , addressing director guillermo del toro from the stage .
no luck tonight for sarah greenwood , who was nominated twice in this category .
the award was presented by lupita nyong'o and kumail nanjiani .
the other nominees were :

documents.title: winner : best sound mixing
text: dunkirk - mark weingarten , gregg landaker and gary a rizzo
perhaps not a great surprise that dunkirk won both sound awards .
it was a shattering audio experience on the big screen .
the other nominees were :

documents.title: sam rockwell pays tribute to philip seymour hoffman
text: we 've just had our first glimpse of an oscar backstage !
sam rockwell - wearing custom-made cufflinks bearing the name of his girlfriend leslie bibb - has just rocked up to the press room , celebratory bottle of beer in hand .

rockwell , who plays disgraced police officer jason dixon in three billboards outside ebbing , missouri , spoke of his preparation - including riding with cops and meeting up with a skin graft doctor .
he then pays an emotional tribute to his friend , the late philip seymour hoffman , having dedicated his oscar to him on stage at the end of his speech .
`` you guys heard that ?
i thought the music was playing , '' he said , looking genuinely pleased , before adding : `` i guess you want to start making me cry .
`` he was an old friend of mine .
he was very close to me and he was an inspiration to all of my peers . ''
rockwell was asked about the fact some people found his character in three billboards problematic for being racist and homophobic .
it 's a complicated issue .
it 's not like they 're redeemed at the end of the movie - they have work to do .
maybe some therapy .
author: Lauren Turner
Entertainment Reporter

documents.title: winner : best sound editing
text: dunkirk - richard king and alex gibson
the other nominees were :

the trophy was presented to him by last year 's best supporting actress , viola davis (
rockwell dedicated his award to philip seymour hoffman in his acceptance speech .
speaking backstage , he said : `` whoever was in my age range phil hoffman was the guy .
he was a great inspiration . ''

documents.title: mary j blige takes to the stage
text: the singer is the first of tonight 's original song nominees to perform .
she 's performing mighty river from mudbound , which she stars in .
blige is the only person in oscars history to be nominated for best supporting actress and best original song in the same year .

documents.title: winner - best documentary feature
text: icarus - bryan fogel and dan cogan
the film , about doping in sport , sees cyclist bryan fogel contact dr grigory rodchenkov , the head of the anti-doping laboratory that tests russian olympians .
fogel said : `` we hope icarus is a wake-up , yes about russia , but we hope more than that , the importance of telling the truth , now more than ever . ''
icarus beat off competition from faces places , co-directed by agnes varda - the oldest nominee in oscars history at 89 years old .
who , incidentally , is attending the ceremony in person tonight , rather than as a cardboard cut-out .
the award was presented by greta gerwig and laura dern .
the other nominees were :
abacus
faces places
last men in aleppo
strong island

documents.title: more references to black panther
text: `` in the 47 minutes since tonight 's show started , black panther has made another $ 48m at the box office , '' jokes kimmel as the ceremony returns after a commercial break .
`` black panther has been so successful at the box office , it 's already the favourite to not get nominated next year , '' he adds .

documents.title: winner - best costume design
text: phantom thread - mark bridges
no surprises here , as this is a film quite literally about costume design .
mark bridges thanks director paul thomas anderson and `` my brilliant crew in london who worked tirelessly to make brilliant dresses and get them on camera '' .
the other nominees were :

documents.title: winner - makeup and hairstyling
text: darkest hour - kazuhiro tsuji , david malinowski & lucy sibbick

this award seems apt and is n't a huge surprise - darkest hour 's hair and make-up team has been heavily praised by critics for helping gary oldman transform into former british prime minister winston churchill .
the award was presented by gal gadot and armie hammer .
the other nominees were :

documents.title: winner - best supporting actor
text: sam rockwell - three billboards outside ebbing , missouri
`` you guys rock ! ''
says rockwell of his fellow nominees .
he also thanks his three billboards co-stars woody harrelson and frances mcdormand .
he thanks `` everybody involved in three billboards and everyone who 's ever looked at a billboard , '' to laughs from the crowd .
the other nominees were :

documents.title: kimmel 's best jokes
text: host jimmy kimmel jokes that president trump described get out as `` the greatest three quarters of a movie ever '' .
pointing out margot robbie in the audience , the presenter says : `` whose kneecaps did tonya harding have to break to get that kind of dream casting ? ''
`` timothee chalamet is missing paw patrol to be here tonight , '' he continues , referring to one of tonight 's youngest nominees .
`` we do n't make films like call me by your name to make money , we make them to upset mike pence , '' he adds , referring to the us vice president .
`` guillermo del toro made a beautiful movie , and thanks to him we will always remember this as the year that men screwed up so badly , women started dating fish . ''
he also brings out dame helen mirren for a funny sequence involving a jet ski - which he offers to the winner tonight who provides the shortest speech .
and with that , kimmel introduces tonight 's first category - best supporting actor .
jimmy kimmel offers a free jet ski to the winner with tonight 's shortest speech .
helen mirren not included .

documents.title: jimmy kimmel 's opening monologue
text: the ceremony kicks off with an old-school black and white video montage , highlighting some of the stars in the audience , before jimmy kimmel takes to the stage .
`` greetings from hollywood .
it is a great honour to be invited back for a second time , '' our master of ceremonies says .
he immediately makes a joke referring to the envelopegate mishap of last year .
`` this year , when you hear your name called , do n't get up right away , '' he laughs .
`` what happened last year was unfortunate , '' he goes on .
`` a week before the show last year the producers asked if i wanted to do some comedy with the accountants .
i said no .
so the accountants went ahead and did comedy on their own .
and i have to hand it to them , it was hilarious . ''
`` i 'm hopeful that things will go smoothly tonight .
this is a big one , this is the 90th academy awards . ''
he also makes reference to harvey weinstein , who has been expelled from the academy after a string of sexual harassment allegations .
`` we ca n't let bad behaviour slide anymore .
the world is watching us , we need to set an example , '' kimmel says .

text: jennifer lawrence is co-presenting the best actress award tonight with jodie foster .
